It s clear to understand why countless five star reviews extravagantly blazon the film poster for La La Land as La La Land is essentially a film critic s dream It s a film about film itself created specifically for film lovers and after a career of dissecting and analyzing an innumerable amount of them it must be a certain thrill for a critic to witness one being deconstructed before their very eyes La La Land first seizes a classic film genre and contorts it re imagining the Old Hollywood musical by juxtaposing a contemporary Los Angeles setting with the heightened whimsical reality of those early 20th century productions straddling the two contrasting eras in such an expert manner that they somehow miraculously harmonize The musical sequences are delightfully executed with exhilarating Baz Luhrmann esque camera swoops capturing charming choreography amongst sumptuous set designs that are doubtlessly littered Tarantino like with suitable film references It s near impossible not to be enraptured by this as La La Land s infectiously joyful tone combined with its sublime filmmaking aspects produce a positively captivating experience reminding us in a modernized and relevant sense exactly why the musical genre is so beloved and producing a refreshing antidote to the relentless cynicism that permeates our recent culture Suitably its narrative is the traditional scenario of a love story between two struggling artists and dreamers with Emma Stone s coffee shop barista Mia enduring multiple brutal auditions in the hope of movie stardom while Ryan Gosling s Seb is on a one man mission to change the modern perception of jazz and regain its glory They re befitting casting with Gosling s stoic charm and Stone s buoyant persona hearkening to that specific bygone era while their wry conversational wit simultaneously grounds them in the present day backdrop Also appropriate is the simplistic nature of their developing romance proving the strength of La La Land and all its components by producing such impactful scenes from these conventional and exhausted romantic comedy tropes These scenes culminate in a transcendent moment as Seb and Mia spontaneously float and ballroom dance amongst the stars of an observatory conceiving a surreal sequence that sincerely embodies the beauty and magic of cinema After reaching such soaring heights of razzle dazzle ness it was perhaps inevitable that La La Land would ultimately fizzle out and in an act of rather unexpected cruelty the enchanting development the film has so effectively accomplished is dismantled before the viewer s eyes The somewhat jarring introduction of Seb s old friend Keith John Legend is the catalyst that spurs this sudden shift of tone as Seb accepts his soulless job offer despite a lasting desire to own a jazz bar Thereafter Seb and Mia s aspirations for themselves and one another are continually dashed and dampened their passions gradually engulfing their passions for each other while the film adopts an unforeseen gloomy essence of realism It s where motifs from director Damien Chazelle s last feature Whiplash 2014 a savage observation of artistic ambition are introduced as Chazelle essentially hijacks this established genre with his personal beliefs and developing directorial trademarks In retrospect the foreshadowing is evident an earlier scene of Seb and Mia strolling through the Warner Brothers studio back lot allows the viewer a peak behind the cinematic curtain before La La Land eventually takes them behind it s own Nevertheless without the sheen of Old Hollywood charm the simplistic nature of the plot is ultimately exposed as the unoriginal clich ridden Fame esque narrative it actually is with its discussions on hopes and dreams now obtaining a level of triteness Additionally the approach is neither authentic nor hard hitting enough to be entirely effective instead striking an unsatisfying middle ground that fails to fulfill the potential of its inspired and intriguing concept Gratefully the film somewhat salvages itself by its culmination reintroducing it s much missed homages with a beautifully performed sequence that in it s own unusual bittersweet way depicts the power film is capable of and is an ode to cinema itself Indeed La La Land is a film about film itself created specifically for film lovers but its exact assessment of the subject is something for the viewer to ponder While there s undoubtedly an ingenious aspect of deconstructing a departed genre for a modern age there s simultaneously an element of cynicism and cinematic sacrilege In a pessimistic society and a film and television landscape that frequently reflect that and it s in this respect La La Land would ironically be more subversive if it retained its jubilant spirit is it truly necessary or beneficial for the audience to glimpse beyond this cinematic curtain For a few hours can ignorance be bliss and can the sanctity of film be sacred while the audience resides temporarily at least in the whimsical escapism of La La Land

neither of them would have done it without the other We never know why we are in certain peoples lives but the power we hold to make a difference is immense Now it is my turn to discover what my dream is I am currently trapped in the world of security and stability and the fear of doing something I am not comfortable with This movie has changed my life and I hope to look back in 10 20 30 40 years to credit this film for being the catalyst for me to start living my life the way I want
In the first time it seems to be just a simple romantic movie but i recommend you to watch it again carefully it s more then you think

SCORE 10 10 I have one word to describe my experience watching this movie Serotonin Even when I was completely sobbing in complete depression I still could not help but marvel at the beauty of what I was experiencing When this movie first came out I remember leaving the theater so frustrated at how it ended How could they build up such a beautiful bond between Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone s characters just for them to rip my young heart out by them not ending up together I was furious and never went back to watch it until now You know who I can thank for that Nicole Kidman I am an AMC A List member and every single time her ad plays before a movie I see the short clip from La La Land This movie tackles so many deep topics about life some of which I am in the heat of battle with There is so much pressure to hold a steady job in order to survive in today s world In Sebastian s case he took the steady paying job at the sacrifice of both his dreams and relationship It s amazing what we will tell ourselves to convince ourselves that we are happy Safety is comfort and comfort leads to happiness But we only get one life on this earth Why would we spend it doing something we don t like for the chance that everything else will work out In Mia s case all she wants was for Sebastian to be supportive of her dream as much as she was for him Sure it stung a lot for her to have a low turn out at her play but it hurt way more for Sebastian not to show up Once they split and he receives the call from the casting agent we see a complete switch in his mentality and the story unfolds beautifully from there Mia gets the part goes to Paris and then 5 years later we are presented with the sad reality that she had moved on had a child and was living her best life And then her and her husband take an unexpected turn to avoid traffic and stumble upon a surprise venue Half way through the movie I was actually inspired to learn Mia and Sebastian s theme on piano and I can t help but cry while playing it because of the meaning behind the song It was their song The song she heard when she first met him and the song she hears 5 years later when walking into a random Jazz bar one night only to find that it was Sebastian s Not only that but the name of the place was Seb s the name that she suggested We then get a scene of what would have happened if things had all gone right and we see a life where Mia and Sebastian are together and happy but are quickly reminded of reality which teaches a very important lesson We can only move forward 2 people once in love forced to go their separate ways to follow their dreams are once again together sharing a magical moment with the song that started it all 6 years ago I didn t understand but now I do They both found happiness and neither of them would have done it without the other We never know why we are in certain peoples lives but the power we hold to make a difference is immense Now it is my turn to discover what my dream is I am currently trapped in the world of security and stability and the fear of doing something I am not comfortable with This movie has changed my life and I hope to look back in 10 20 30 40 years to credit this film for being the catalyst for me to start living my life the way I want

review_comment: I like musicals there s not a lot of good ones and that one is certainly the one I could recommend Little bit sad at the end though

Watched this twice time and cried like never saw it before I hate how true of the story someone came into your life to make it more beautiful but he may not the one who stay very last And sometime we have to choose between that two things Hurt

review_title: A truly magnificent work of art
review_comment: I just watched La La Land for the third time The first was in the cinemas I suggested it to my wife The reviews were mixed but I felt it would be fun From the opening scene and all the way through I was repeatedly laughing with delight or had tears of joy in my eyes To say I loved it would be an understatement I think it is one of the most enjoyable beautiful artistic and moving movies I have ever seen This from a lover of movies It is a work of art I think if you view it in this light you cannot help but acknowledge it is truly a masterpiece Nothing like it exists The scenes the music the acting is so full of life So perfectly and lovingly crafted I loved it so much my wife and I returned a week later with our son Although they both enjoyed it I don t think they appreciate the brilliance of the artistry as much as I do So today I watch it for the third time on my own and I love it more than ever No movie has ever made me smile so much that euphoric feeling when you get goosebumps You would think third time watching that it would have lessened but I still am blown away by how beautifully crafted this movie is I know the reviews are mixed I generally don t write reviews But I feel that when you experience something that to you is one of the most enjoyable of experiences you have had you should let others know

This movie is the worst movie we have ever seen in our entire lives People of all ages will be crushed with this movie s ending I am so very disappointed with this movie and my fellow associate cried This ending not only leaves us upset but extremely dissatisfied If you are looking for a movie that crushes your dreams this is the movie for you The Notebook was better And they fucking died As far as romance goes I would like if it was more similar to that At the start of this movie I had depression At the end I wanted to fucking die End game this movie sucks and I would highly recommend to give the director a sucker punch I cri evrtim WATCH THE NOTEBOOK

review_title: This film is a great eye opener
review_comment: Well can t say I watched this at a good time I can relate to the movie on a very deep personal level Don t watch this if you are longing after someone you are just going to attach more to the memories and that s going to hurt you more than their abscence Anyways a real review The film has a perfect pacing not too long but well explained The sound design and the soundtrack doesnt break audioexperts ears cause it doesnt really need to The emotions you are supposed to feel are accompanied by the music while the visuals complete the whole picture The coloring the shots and the camera work on this film is masterful no other words to describe it really Perfectly conveys the feeling of loving someone but having to let them go on their way Although its a musical on paper definitely more of a drama in my books In conclusion If you actually love someone you have to let them go on their way Watch their steps from afar and support them deep down The past cant comeback it can only imitate

I may have noticed that this film won the Oscars so I ll write a review about it The characters of this film are listed below Mia is number one in the La La Land character list because I love women and girls Her face looks pretty although I hate it when she argues with others Sebastian comes next in La La Land because his romantic fascination for Mia is high However I don t like it when he s been accused for raping people I m a little tired to continue writing for now and I don t want to know much about the other La La Land characters Anyway this film has lovely characteristics and I hope you think like that too

I will forever cherish Damien Chazelle and Justin Hurwitz for making this film and soundtrack It means much more to me than words could ever describe But I can say this much It influences me on a almost daily basis Thank you for showing me how perfectly music can be blended into story Thank you for the choreographies the soundtrack the colors all the actors the designs the story the tears the laughs the joy and the hope it gives me everytime I watch this masterpiece Because that s what it is to me and always will be

review_title: Cinematography and Music Personified Into Motion Picture
review_comment: One of the best movies ever made La La Land after a long time brings justice to the genre of romance comedy and drama simultaneously which is itself a rare combination But the most vital part is the magical potion given by this movie to music in Hollywood Excellent direction by Damien Chazelle reflected through those brilliant single cut songs Justin Hurwitz s music is so melodious that 2 academy awards seem to be insufficient to honour The choreography Herculean task for these long songs fantastically done by Mandy Moore Sebastian played by Ryan Gosling and Mia by Emma Stone are the best performances of the duo which even earned Emma an Oscar Other casting is perfect The opening scene of the movie will remain a subject of study for the students of cinematography in the coming decades All the songs in the movie their music and choreography are optical treats Beautifully shot scenes and colourful costumes add those last elements which makes this movie stand completely different The song City of Stars is the perfect depiction of feelings of the characters at different points in movie A lovely night will forever remain a perfect date song for couples now onwards There are many iconic scenes in the movie for instance a scene in the planetarium which seals both the leading characters relationship The ending of the movie is definitely melancholic but satisfactory at the same time La La Land is about chasing dreams but enjoying life those fragile colours around La La Land teaches the true meaning of love and life The age old tradition conveying love is only about being together is negated professionally by the producers After all love is love even if the one you love part ways it s the feeling that stays within Though lightly but the movie gives subtle message of love responsibility dreams endeavors and struggle This masterpiece is a story complete in itself so the sequel is not expected which is a sad part Also paying tributes to great old ideals through various actions the jazz and it s rejuvenation the influential lyrics are some of the most beautiful aspects This movie indeed takes the viewers to the La La Land of joy but brings them back too and depicts reality of life through amazing twists and turns The history of cinemas will always be stated as incomplete without the prestigious mention of La La Land and substantially it s music too

review_title: The best movie I have seen!
review_comment: SCORE 10 10 I have one word to describe my experience watching this movie Serotonin Even when I was completely sobbing in complete depression I still could not help but marvel at the beauty of what I was experiencing When this movie first came out I remember leaving the theater so frustrated at how it ended How could they build up such a beautiful bond between Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone s characters just for them to rip my young heart out by them not ending up together I was furious and never went back to watch it until now You know who I can thank for that Nicole Kidman I am an AMC A List member and every single time her ad plays before a movie I see the short clip from La La Land This movie tackles so many deep topics about life some of which I am in the heat of battle with There is so much pressure to hold a steady job in order to survive in today s world In Sebastian s case he took the steady paying job at the sacrifice of both his dreams and relationship It s amazing what we will tell ourselves to convince ourselves that we are happy Safety is comfort and comfort leads to happiness But we only get one life on this earth Why would we spend it doing something we don t like for the chance that everything else will work out In Mia s case all she wants was for Sebastian to be supportive of her dream as much as she was for him Sure it stung a lot for her to have a low turn out at her play but it hurt way more for Sebastian not to show up Once they split and he receives the call from the casting agent we see a complete switch in his mentality and the story unfolds beautifully from there Mia gets the part goes to Paris and then 5 years later we are presented with the sad reality that she had moved on had a child and was living her best life And then her and her husband take an unexpected turn to avoid traffic and stumble upon a surprise venue Half way through the movie I was actually inspired to learn Mia and Sebastian s theme on piano and I can t help but cry while playing it because of the meaning behind the song It was their song The song she heard when she first met him and the song she hears 5 years later when walking into a random Jazz bar one night only to find that it was Sebastian s Not only that but the name of the place was Seb s the name that she suggested We then get a scene of what would have happened if things had all gone right and we see a life where Mia and Sebastian are together and happy but are quickly reminded of reality which teaches a very important lesson We can only move forward 2 people once in love forced to go their separate ways to follow their dreams are once again together sharing a magical moment with the song that started it all 6 years ago I didn t understand but now I do They both found happiness and neither of them would have done it without the other We never know why we are in certain peoples lives but the power we hold to make a difference is immense Now it is my turn to discover what my dream is I am currently trapped in the world of security and stability and the fear of doing something I am not comfortable with This movie has changed my life and I hope to look back in 10 20 30 40 years to credit this film for being the catalyst for me to start living my life the way I want

review_title: A feeling I have never felt before
review_comment: This movie gave me a feeling that I have never felt before Somewhere between getting punched in the gut and smelling your favorite cologne The world needs more movies that depict reality as beautifully as La La Land does

I absolutely adored this movie you should actually listen to the hype It s very well put together with a good script the acting is flawless and the whole movie gives you a feel good feeling From start to finish it had a smile on my face I don t understand why there s so many people giving bad reviews because this movie is a real gem and shows the sparkle glitz and glam of LA and brings you back to earth with LA s underbelly the struggles to achieve the dream If you have to see a movie it must be La La Land it won t disappoint and if you don t like it then you must I don t know have no taste I presume and need a check up or need to be educated There really isn t another movie like this it isn t only a delightful movie it is beautiful as well

My gf rated this 1 so I m rating it 10 out of spite It s okay By the way it s called la la land cause its set in LA only found out recently mind blown
Perfect in every elements I love how ryan tell the heartbroke through the eyes

If you are a musician a wannabe actor or just a fellow dreamer La La Land is a movie litteraly made for you This is a movie you will never want to end This is a movie like we haven t seen in a while It will make you dream laugh cry and forget about your reality It s been a while since I have seen a movie that haunted me for so long I cannot thank Chazelle enough for this true masterpiece he gave us I waited too much to see this film because I thought it had been too hyped by too many people and because I don t like to follow the mass But I was wrong all this success was really worth it And I really hope that a lot of people understood the message and the importance of this film The best thing is that I wasn t expecting anything when I started the movie but now I know that there will be forever a before and an after La La Land If you like musicals I can assure you that you will be drawn in it from the very first second and that the music will stay with you

This movie is a cinematic masterpiece It s a film that will resonate with you and will be remembered as an incredible movie forever Everything from the music to the message this movie is perfect The visuals are nothing less then stunning and the costumes and set are just stunning I can t express how incredible this film is

In my personal opinion this movie is beautiful and unique Im no movie critic or anything like that but this movie was such an passionate and emotional experience that it s won a special place in my heart as my favorite movie I watched La La Land for the first time with my grandmother she loved this movie as much as I do We geek out about it at times this movie fills me with nostalgia and content when I think about it It s magical how a movie can bring people together like that For anyone who hasn t seen it I definitely recommend it if you re a fan or romance or musicals

review_title: Man, I loved this movie. I'd say the best of 2016.
review_comment: I saw this for my 15th birthday and it s great from the opening Cinemascope card to the very last frame Sebastian Ryan Gosling is a man who wants to start a jazz club to enliven the genre and Mia the always talented Emma Stone is an aspiring actress who is also a waitress Naturally these two meet and the film follows them and their ups and downs I hate giving away spoilers so I won t The soundtrack to this film is very catchy the opening scene alone is a musical number in a traffic jam and I reckon if your kid is mature enough to understand the film there is very little inappropriate content but the PG 13 rating in the US is because Ryan Gosling says an F word once and there s a little bit of bad language and the chemistry between Ryan and Emma just feels very natural The film is a hybrid of a musical and a serious romantic drama and the singing from these actors is pretty good the dancing more so but when it needs to be emotional it is When it needs to be funny it is There is just a magical quality to this that I can t describe If there s one thing I can nitpick it s that the film can sometimes be a little slow But that s nitpicking Seriously see this when you can you will not regret it Video review link for this and The Edge of Seventeen  www youtube com watch v 6hfnx7B4KHQ t 50s DRAK Entertainment channel link  www youtube com channel UCLPGKPD7g2FjF2I2pk8OKmw

To all those who have fallen in love or wish to fall this is a true masterpiece You will not look your watch once for about 2hours of screen time Best performance fro Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling they have pulled up the characters miraculously what a love story what an art Moolah la la land

Mia Dolan hoped she can be a famous actress She had applied for a job of actress everywhere and very hard But she felt every time she has been out of sorts Although she had flat many times but she never gave up In the end after she had applyed for a job of actress many times and very hard she became a actress The movie told everyone anything you do hard then you ll be success

I didn t realize it was a musical Not my thing Thought it would be good based on description Then figured out quickly it is a musical Maybe weird people who like musicals would like it but not the normal man

The trailers for La La Land didn t do much to entice me to go see it but I have to admit that any doubts I had were wiped out of my mind the moment the film started I couldn t believe they managed to pull off a complicated musical number in one shot on an LA freeway of all places That s quite an opening From there we re introduced to our two leads Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling who still clearly have chemistry left over from their previous film together It s such a joy to watch them on screen together It s hard not to find them sympathetic The story isn t anything we haven t seen before in stuff like A Star is Born but the witty dialogue stars chemistry and musical numbers help set it apart Sure Gosling and Stone are far from trained singers or dancers but they do just fine Their voices never soar like you d expect from a big Broadway belter but then again they have a camera 3 inches away from their face If I had any nitpicks it would be that the sound mixing is sometimes a bit off In the opening musical sequence I couldn t really understand the lyrics either due to bad mixing or the singers whisper singing If it s playing near you definitely go check it out

review_title: A praise for La La Land
review_comment: SCORE 10 10 I have one word to describe my experience watching this movie Serotonin Even when I was completely sobbing in complete depression I still could not help but marvel at the beauty of what I was experiencing When this movie first came out I remember leaving the theater so frustrated at how it ended How could they build up such a beautiful bond between Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone s characters just for them to rip my young heart out by them not ending up together I was furious and never went back to watch it until now You know who I can thank for that Nicole Kidman I am an AMC A List member and every single time her ad plays before a movie I see the short clip from La La Land This movie tackles so many deep topics about life some of which I am in the heat of battle with There is so much pressure to hold a steady job in order to survive in today s world In Sebastian s case he took the steady paying job at the sacrifice of both his dreams and relationship It s amazing what we will tell ourselves to convince ourselves that we are happy Safety is comfort and comfort leads to happiness But we only get one life on this earth Why would we spend it doing something we don t like for the chance that everything else will work out In Mia s case all she wants was for Sebastian to be supportive of her dream as much as she was for him Sure it stung a lot for her to have a low turn out at her play but it hurt way more for Sebastian not to show up Once they split and he receives the call from the casting agent we see a complete switch in his mentality and the story unfolds beautifully from there Mia gets the part goes to Paris and then 5 years later we are presented with the sad reality that she had moved on had a child and was living her best life And then her and her husband take an unexpected turn to avoid traffic and stumble upon a surprise venue Half way through the movie I was actually inspired to learn Mia and Sebastian s theme on piano and I can t help but cry while playing it because of the meaning behind the song It was their song The song she heard when she first met him and the song she hears 5 years later when walking into a random Jazz bar one night only to find that it was Sebastian s Not only that but the name of the place was Seb s the name that she suggested We then get a scene of what would have happened if things had all gone right and we see a life where Mia and Sebastian are together and happy but are quickly reminded of reality which teaches a very important lesson We can only move forward 2 people once in love forced to go their separate ways to follow their dreams are once again together sharing a magical moment with the song that started it all 6 years ago I didn t understand but now I do They both found happiness and neither of them would have done it without the other We never know why we are in certain peoples lives but the power we hold to make a difference is immense Now it is my turn to discover what my dream is I am currently trapped in the world of security and stability and the fear of doing something I am not comfortable with This movie has changed my life and I hope to look back in 10 20 30 40 years to credit this film for being the catalyst for me to start living my life the way I want

review_title: How can a movie change my outlook on love
review_comment: Its a realy great movie that take the subject of love in real life that relative with job and success in life in very dramatic way If u need my advice Thats movie is for u

SCORE 10 10 I have one word to describe my experience watching this movie Serotonin Even when I was completely sobbing in complete depression I still could not help but marvel at the beauty of what I was experiencing When this movie first came out I remember leaving the theater so frustrated at how it ended How could they build up such a beautiful bond between Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone s characters just for them to rip my young heart out by them not ending up together I was furious and never went back to watch it until now You know who I can thank for that Nicole Kidman I am an AMC A List member and every single time her ad plays before a movie I see the short clip from La La Land This movie tackles so many deep topics about life some of which I am in the heat of battle with There is so much pressure to hold a steady job in order to survive in today s world In Sebastian s case he took the steady paying job at the sacrifice of both his dreams and relationship It s amazing what we will tell ourselves to convince ourselves that we are happy Safety is comfort and comfort leads to happiness But we only get one life on this earth Why would we spend it doing something we don t like for the chance that everything else will work out In Mia s case all she wants was for Sebastian to be supportive of her dream as much as she was for him Sure it stung a lot for her to have a low turn out at her play but it hurt way more for Sebastian not to show up Once they split and he receives the call from the casting agent we see a complete switch in his mentality and the story unfolds beautifully from there Mia gets the part goes to Paris and then 5 years later we are presented with the sad reality that she had moved on had a child and was living her best life And then her and her husband take an unexpected turn to avoid traffic and stumble upon a surprise venue Half way through the movie I was actually inspired to learn Mia and Sebastian s theme on piano and I can t help but cry while playing it because of the meaning behind the song It was their song The song she heard when she first met him and the song she hears 5 years later when walking into a random Jazz bar one night only to find that it was Sebastian s Not only that but the name of the place was Seb s the name that she suggested We then get a scene of what would have happened if things had all gone right and we see a life where Mia and Sebastian are together and happy but are quickly reminded of reality which teaches a very important lesson We can only move forward 2 people once in love forced to go their separate ways to follow their dreams are once again together sharing a magical moment with the song that started it all 6 years ago I didn t understand but now I do They both found happiness and neither of them would have done it without the other We never know why we are in certain peoples lives but the power we hold to make a difference is immense Now it is my turn to discover what my dream is I am currently trapped in the world of security and stability and the fear of doing something I am not comfortable with This movie has changed my life and I hope to look back in 10 20 30 40 years to credit this film for being the catalyst for me to start living my life the way I want

review_title: Balled my eyes out (shaking, screaming, crying, throwing up)
review_comment: I can t believe I could experience such heart ache from watching a musical Mia and Sebastian s theme is one of the most eloquently and soul binding classical pieces ever to exist and it lives in my head rent free It brings upon TEARS every time I hear it This film has so much emotion even I someone who is emotionally unavailable somehow connected with both characters their goals aspirations dreams and subsequently their pitfalls When the shot includes the skyline my eyes are blessed with pure magnificence the mixture of warm and cool tones is nothing short of genius It gives a whimsical feel and after watching this I feel my will to live has been restored

La La Land directed by Damien Chazelle is a visually stunning film that attempts to revive the classic Hollywood musical genre The film stars Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling as two struggling artists in Los Angeles who fall in love and pursue their dreams of making it in show business From a critical standpoint La La Land is a well crafted movie that showcases the immense talent of its cast and crew The cinematography is breathtaking with vibrant colors and sweeping camera movements that evoke a sense of nostalgia for classic Hollywood musicals The musical score composed by Justin Hurwitz is equally impressive with memorable songs that capture the spirit of the film

After watching the movie for the second time I realized that it is the greatest movie I have ever seen His masterpiece I admire it personally the director was able to extract every emotion in me the nervous painful and happy feelings This is what I consider True art and one of the reasons for my love for it is the wonderful music of the film and the dazzling pieces The actors played the most wonderful roles and the most wonderful scenes in this film and its ending was one of the best endings I will keep remembering the film from happiness colors music love story and sad times He has a place in my heart I thank all those who produced this symbolic masterpiece

La la land La la land Rarely have I expirienced a film so powerful a movie whith such a powerfull ending heck most directors would be scared to have such an ending everyting the movie was build upon everything we thought during the movie gave us a bittersweet ending Like a wave taking away your hardly build sandcastle into the seemingley infinite ocean Thats how I would describe this movie And I recommend it to everyone A seemingley hearthwarming story about a couple that just wants to achieve their drems It takes a new approach on what succes really is And makes urself ask the question What is succes What would you give up for your dreams Ive rarely probably never come across a movie wirh so much depth With a perfectly fitting name la la land A movie that tells us that unlike hollywood movies real live doesnt always have a happy ending A seemingly innocent movie abour two people trying to make it big in hollywood But there is so much more to it But oh well you gott to find that out yourself Spectacular movie 10 10

SCORE 10 10 I have one word to describe my experience watching this movie Serotonin Even when I was completely sobbing in complete depression I still could not help but marvel at the beauty of what I was experiencing When this movie first came out I remember leaving the theater so frustrated at how it ended How could they build up such a beautiful bond between Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone s characters just for them to rip my young heart out by them not ending up together I was furious and never went back to watch it until now You know who I can thank for that Nicole Kidman I am an AMC A List member and every single time her ad plays before a movie I see the short clip from La La Land This movie tackles so many deep topics about life some of which I am in the heat of battle with There is so much pressure to hold a steady job in order to survive in today s world In Sebastian s case he took the steady paying job at the sacrifice of both his dreams and relationship It s amazing what we will tell ourselves to convince ourselves that we are happy Safety is comfort and comfort leads to happiness But we only get one life on this earth Why would we spend it doing something we don t like for the chance that everything else will work out In Mia s case all she wants was for Sebastian to be supportive of her dream as much as she was for him Sure it stung a lot for her to have a low turn out at her play but it hurt way more for Sebastian not to show up Once they split and he receives the call from the casting agent we see a complete switch in his mentality and the story unfolds beautifully from there Mia gets the part goes to Paris and then 5 years later we are presented with the sad reality that she had moved on had a child and was living her best life And then her and her husband take an unexpected turn to avoid traffic and stumble upon a surprise venue Half way through the movie I was actually inspired to learn Mia and Sebastian s theme on piano and I can t help but cry while playing it because of the meaning behind the song It was their song The song she heard when she first met him and the song she hears 5 years later when walking into a random Jazz bar one night only to find that it was Sebastian s Not only that but the name of the place was Seb s the name that she suggested We then get a scene of what would have happened if things had all gone right and we see a life where Mia and Sebastian are together and happy but are quickly reminded of reality which teaches a very important lesson We can only move forward 2 people once in love forced to go their separate ways to follow their dreams are once again together sharing a magical moment with the song that started it all 6 years ago I didn t understand but now I do They both found happiness and neither of them would have done it without the other We never know why we are in certain peoples lives but the power we hold to make a difference is immense Now it is my turn to discover what my dream is I am currently trapped in the world of security and stability and the fear of doing something I am not comfortable with This movie has changed my life and I hope to look back in 10 20 30 40 years to credit this film for being the catalyst for me to start living my life the way I want

This Film captured the Beauty of mixing Colors to give you a visible Masterpiece not only in 1 or 2 or 3 scenes It s most of the film which is absolutely bonkers The music in this movie was always universal everyone could enjoy it even me who likes very few types of music The casting of Emma was nearly perfect But I would ve prefered other actresses for the role nevertheless it won t disappoint you at all she s a sweetheart I hope chazelle Expands his filmography choices so that his unique style of filming covers as many genres as possible he is presenting pure art and I appreciate it wholeheartedly

La La Land is a film that completely changed the trajectory of the movie musical film category Musicals are best known for their theatrical atmosphere To see a musical one would typically buy tickets to a local show and see live performers There was a great phenomenon back around the 30s 40s when movie musicals made their way onto the scene thanks to no longer having the barrier of the silent film era It appears there s a highly anticipated movie musical once every 5 or so years These films are typically movie adaptations of stage productions This is what makes La La Land so different from the rest it was its own completely unique show and film all in one La La Land follows two individuals who are in the process of chasing their dreams We meet Mia our leading lady who aspires to grace the big screen one day Mia spends her day working a coffee shop on a movie set in hopes that someday she ll be the actress on set We also meet Sebastian a jazz loving musician who wants to play the music he loves He dreams of opening a jazz club where he can be his own boss and play whatever kind of music he likes Throughout the beginning of the film Mia and Sebastian s paths continue to cross In the beginning neither one can stand the other After a certain amount of time the two begin to wonder could this be fate and choose to try and get to know each other This film is about love life and dreams It is such a heartfelt and realistic film that almost every viewer will sympathize with in one way or another This plot is coupled with the aspects of a musical It is a beautiful film to watch The creators wanted to pay homage to one of the most iconic movie musicals of all time one that solidified the genre Singin in the Rain What makes these films so beautiful is their use of technicolor The movies are vibrant and encapsulating The use of technicolor in Singin in the Rain was a brand new concept at the time We can tell that La La Land is paying homage to this classic because technicolor is not widely used as often in this day and age of film Since this movie is a musical there s a great use of music There are numerous show stopping numbers that never seem out of place The songwriters did such a phenomenal job at writing songs that fit certain emotions so well Such as the song Someone in the Crowd This song encapsulates the feeling of having plans but feeling so drained from the day that you don t want to go anymore It s all about friends finally convincing you that you never know who s going to be there that you should know The persuasion throughout the song ends up breaking Mia down and she agrees to get dressed and go to the party which then really kicks off the events of the plotline between Mia and Sebastian There s also a use of a tune entitled Mia and Sebastian s Theme This piece is so beautiful and warms my heart every time I think about it It s a couple cords that we hear Sebastian playing at the beginning of the film that ends up growing so much once he meets Mia What really cements this movie is that it feels as though it s a musical first and a film second It has every element of what makes a musical great The movie uses the opening song to their advantage perfectly They use it to set the scene and introduce us to where our story will be taking place This is a device utilized by musicals to help jumpstart exposition A great example of this being in the musical Hamilton In Hamilton we are introduced to our main character and the setting through a song In both of these opening numbers we don t hear from our main characters we hear from the world of people around them Something that really stuck out to me was the use of camerawork for our main exposition song Someone in the Crowd The bulk of the song takes place in Mia s apartment as the roommates are all getting ready The way the song is filmed includes a single shot camera The camera pans from roommate to roommate and follows them as they navigate through the apartment After everyone is dressed and ready the roommates get into the car and there s a sequence of flashing bright lights displayed throughout the city Once at the party the camera follows just Mia for a while using the single shot What I love about this party scene is the use of background actors As Mia walks through the party she didn t want to be at feeling all alone we see everyone seemingly in slow motion In reality there s no slow motion the background actors are simply mimicking slow motion throughout their actions This use of camerawork keeps the viewers eyes locked in on everything happening This song is a big piece of exposition as it gets our leading lady Mia out and ready to mingle It also just so happens that after the sequence of this song Mia meets her soon to be love interest What s so beautiful about this movie is how we get to see the behind the scenes of both Sebastian and Mia s lives When they pass briefly we move into Mia s storyline and get to see what her life consists of When the two finally end up in the same place once again we then jump back and get to see what makes up Sebastian s life We feel equally introduced to each character and it helps the audience to better understand why they act the way that they do throughout their early interactions It also makes the crowd root for them and want them to have their happy endings as well as each other This movie makes you care Taking all of these elements I ve discussed into consideration I personally would review this movie as a 10 10 In the past after the first watch I may not have rated it so high as I was not a fan of how the movie ended However through more watches and growing up a bit I ve grown to love the ending of this film It s a heartbreakingly realistic depiction of real life It makes the viewer sit in silence and contemplate not only the past two hours of the film they ve just watched but also their own life and what they want to become of it

SCORE 10 10 I have one word to describe my experience watching this movie Serotonin Even when I was completely sobbing in complete depression I still could not help but marvel at the beauty of what I was experiencing When this movie first came out I remember leaving the theater so frustrated at how it ended How could they build up such a beautiful bond between Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone s characters just for them to rip my young heart out by them not ending up together I was furious and never went back to watch it until now You know who I can thank for that Nicole Kidman I am an AMC A List member and every single time her ad plays before a movie I see the short clip from La La Land This movie tackles so many deep topics about life some of which I am in the heat of battle with There is so much pressure to hold a steady job in order to survive in today s world In Sebastian s case he took the steady paying job at the sacrifice of both his dreams and relationship It s amazing what we will tell ourselves to convince ourselves that we are happy Safety is comfort and comfort leads to happiness But we only get one life on this earth Why would we spend it doing something we don t like for the chance that everything else will work out In Mia s case all she wants was for Sebastian to be supportive of her dream as much as she was for him Sure it stung a lot for her to have a low turn out at her play but it hurt way more for Sebastian not to show up Once they split and he receives the call from the casting agent we see a complete switch in his mentality and the story unfolds beautifully from there Mia gets the part goes to Paris and then 5 years later we are presented with the sad reality that she had moved on had a child and was living her best life And then her and her husband take an unexpected turn to avoid traffic and stumble upon a surprise venue Half way through the movie I was actually inspired to learn Mia and Sebastian s theme on piano and I can t help but cry while playing it because of the meaning behind the song It was their song The song she heard when she first met him and the song she hears 5 years later when walking into a random Jazz bar one night only to find that it was Sebastian s Not only that but the name of the place was Seb s the name that she suggested We then get a scene of what would have happened if things had all gone right and we see a life where Mia and Sebastian are together and happy but are quickly reminded of reality which teaches a very important lesson We can only move forward 2 people once in love forced to go their separate ways to follow their dreams are once again together sharing a magical moment with the song that started it all 6 years ago I didn t understand but now I do They both found happiness and neither of them would have done it without the other We never know why we are in certain peoples lives but the power we hold to make a difference is immense Now it is my turn to discover what my dream is I am currently trapped in the world of security and stability and the fear of doing something I am not comfortable with This movie has changed my life and I hope to look back in 10 20 30 40 years to credit this film for being the catalyst for me to start living my life the way I want

review_title: This film breaks my heart beautifully.
review_comment: La La Land is a cinematic masterpiece a vibrant tapestry of dreams and love interwoven with the raw realities of life It s a harmonious blend of classic and contemporary a poignant tribute to the golden age of Hollywood yet a tale that resonates with modern audiences The performances of Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling are captivating their chemistry palpable The music is enchanting each note carrying the weight of unspoken emotions The ending though bittersweet adds depth to the narrative reminding us that not all love stories culminate in togetherness yet they can still be beautiful This film is a celebration of love passion and the relentless pursuit of dreams It s a heartrending journey that leaves you with a lingering melody of what could have been A truly unforgettable experience I really love this movie and will always be my favorite

review_title: La La Land: An Dreamlike Ode to Dream and Love
review_comment: La La Land is not just a movie it s a heartwarming and visually stunning journey that celebrates the dreamers the artists and the romantics among us Directed by Damien Chazelle this film is a modern musical masterpiece that captures the essence of Hollywood charm while delivering a captivating narrative The story revolves around Mia an aspiring actress and Sebastian a jazz musician who come across in the vibrant and challenging city of Los Angeles Their love story unfolds against the backdrop of Hollywood s relentless pursuit of fame and fortune making their connection a beacon of hope and reality Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling deliver remarkable performances exuding incredible chemistry that draw the audience into their passion What sets La La Land apart is its ability to seamlessly blend the classic musical style with contemporary sensibility The movie s music and choreography pay homage to the golden era of Hollywood musicals without losing modern It successfully captures the magic of classic musicals and injecting a fresh breath air into the genre And the film s breathtaking cinematography and set designs transform Los Angeles into a character in itself beautifully capturing the city s magic La La Land is a particular form to endure endless appeal of musicals and it s a cinematic experience that a journey reminds us to chase our dreams and embrace love This film doesn t just entertain Chazelle s direction and the film s rhythm make La La Land an emotional rollercoaster It explores the line between dreams and conformity art and commercialism leaving audience infinite enlightenment

When I went to see La La Land I was sure I wouldn t like but as the first scene started I was amazed completely transported to a musical world of sing and dance I really think it is worth going to see Going back to the first scene on the Santa Monica Freeway For about 5 minutes were just dancing and singing I really thought that gosling and stone were PERFECT for the roles and if Emma Watson and Miles Teller would have been terrible in those roles The Music is just incredible and the jazz is perfect GO SEE IT ITS AMAZING If you are into love and chick flicks you will love it it really shows you what life would have been like in the 1940s And as soon as I got home from the cinema I downloaded the soundtrack to listen to my 3 favourite song Someone In the Crowd A Lovely Night and City Of Stars It really is worth going to see xxx

review_title: I Was Enchanted to Meet You
review_comment: Mesmerizing enchanting and romantic La La land is such a dreamlike movie that attracts music lovers like me most It is an ode to the golden era of Hollywood there are so many analogous comments in diverse reviews like this and I thoroughly agree with that The melody the dance the lyrics and every gesture of the actors and actresses is so entranced Particularly I would like to share the affinity the songs in this film rendered to me The beginning song Another Day of Song was vibrant and the sequence had the very strong visual impulse so that is was regarded as one of the greatest beginning sequences The song City Of Stars was the most renowned song which won Best Original Song of Oscar Someone In the Crowd was the BGM when I was writing this review it could still remind me the first time I watch this period of film it was excited Nevertheless I fancy the song A Lovely Night most not only the soft melody made me feel comfortable but also the marvelous acting from Emma and Gosling had really created pink bubbles in the air even though they were satirizing one another D As a Swftie this film reminded me of a Taylor s song in her album Speak Now Enchanted All the encounter was just like a wildest dream happened in wonderland and at the end of the love story the came back to the reality All of us cloud notice the very homage it displayed to golden era of Hollywood Recommend it to the music lovers and all the people who have dreams to realize

OK that title might seem like click bate but it isn t I ll get back to the title in a second But first a quick La La Land review If your looking for the second coming of Singing in the Rain La La Land is not it but that doesn t mean that it s a bad movie In fact it s quite wonderful but in a more subtle Umbrellas of Cherbourg The Young Girls of Rochefort way It s colorful captivating and engaging My only real complaint is it needs one more big number about 3 4 of the way in There is a long stretch of the film without any singing Back to the title of this review I ll put a link below to a La La Land filming location video on YouTube that shows the house in the dream sequence that Sebastian and Mia live at in real life has swastikas all over it I m not sure if any swastikas made it into the actual film Pretty weird right  www youtube com watch v l4gXz0qBYf8

There s this quote I once I read Life is like a bad movie You can sit through it you can drink and laugh at it or you can leave early Since I had no alcohol at the time I chose not to suffer and just leave mid way I rarely stop watching a movie in the middle but then again most films even the poorly written ones tend to have even a bit of substantial context to them In this case I felt like I watched one of those ridiculous Bollywood movies only instead of the occasional burst into a dance without any reason that happens in Bollywood here we have a movie that does it through at least the first hour after which I decided I ve seen enough I won t go into detail but I felt like there was no plot to hold on to I love musical movies but in this case it seemed to me like I was watching a generic pop song with a very shallow meaning I didn t care about the characters so all these magical musical scenes seemed meaningless I m happy for anyone who did enjoy it and did feel immersed in the love of story of the protagonists but I simply couldn t I am writing this review because I felt it s shameful that this movie deserved an Oscar nomination but while writing it I realized that if I could care more about the story I d probably love the film Guess the Academy saw something I didn t seems to constantly for years now Did I lose change my taste in movies or is it the academy

happiness and neither of them would have done it without the other We never know why we are in certain peoples lives but the power we hold to make a difference is immense Now it is my turn to discover what my dream is I am currently trapped in the world of security and stability and the fear of doing something I am not comfortable with This movie has changed my life and I hope to look back in 10 20 30 40 years to credit this film for being the catalyst for me to start living my life the way I want

My partner and I really tried to watch this movie even though we do not watch musicals really 1 hour into the movie and we definitely had enough and switched to another movie as it just was way too boring I just could not feel during this movie whether joy sadness nor love really The musical parts were so cringy making us feel very uncomfy and we ended up skipping those parts I was honestly looking forward for this movie but this was a bloody disappointment

Love in the 21st century is fragile and reluctant Am I sure I want to give in What about my dreams Am I getting exposed or dependent Sebastian and Mia s romance was sweet but uncertain both of them half in half out without any loss of control even when the things went bad A fine dialog between individuality and love a subtle game of hiding or showing their feelings That subtlety of emotion is what the sweetness and warmness of the movie derives from And it s this outdoor light this purple sky always half day half night that sheds its magic all over the film They say early morning and early evening are the best moments of the day and that s because half light gives a soothing sense of safety and carefreeness And indoors the light is either the dim one of a jazz club or an early morning sun shining through the windows That light protects and calms us undermines our defenses and allows us to dream

SCORE 10 10 I have one word to describe my experience watching this movie Serotonin Even when I was completely sobbing in complete depression I still could not help but marvel at the beauty of what I was experiencing When this movie first came out I remember leaving the theater so frustrated at how it ended How could they build up such a beautiful bond between Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone s characters just for them to rip my young heart out by them not ending up together I was furious and never went back to watch it until now You know who I can thank for that Nicole Kidman I am an AMC A List member and every single time her ad plays before a movie I see the short clip from La La Land This movie tackles so many deep topics about life some of which I am in the heat of battle with There is so much pressure to hold a steady job in order to survive in today s world In Sebastian s case he took the steady paying job at the sacrifice of both his dreams and relationship It s amazing what we will tell ourselves to convince ourselves that we are happy Safety is comfort and comfort leads to happiness But we only get one life on this earth Why would we spend it doing something we don t like for the chance that everything else will work out In Mia s case all she wants was for Sebastian to be supportive of her dream as much as she was for him Sure it stung a lot for her to have a low turn out at her play but it hurt way more for Sebastian not to show up Once they split and he receives the call from the casting agent we see a complete switch in his mentality and the story unfolds beautifully from there Mia gets the part goes to Paris and then 5 years later we are presented with the sad reality that she had moved on had a child and was living her best life And then her and her husband take an unexpected turn to avoid traffic and stumble upon a surprise venue Half way through the movie I was actually inspired to learn Mia and Sebastian s theme on piano and I can t help but cry while playing it because of the meaning behind the song It was their song The song she heard when she first met him and the song she hears 5 years later when walking into a random Jazz bar one night only to find that it was Sebastian s Not only that but the name of the place was Seb s the name that she suggested We then get a scene of what would have happened if things had all gone right and we see a life where Mia and Sebastian are together and happy but are quickly reminded of reality which teaches a very important lesson We can only move forward 2 people once in love forced to go their separate ways to follow their dreams are once again together sharing a magical moment with the song that started it all 6 years ago I didn t understand but now I do They both found happiness and neither of them would have done it without the other We never know why we are in certain peoples lives but the power we hold to make a difference is immense Now it is my turn to discover what my dream is I am currently trapped in the world of security and stability and the fear of doing something I am not comfortable with This movie has changed my life and I hope to look back in 10 20 30 40 years to credit this film for being the catalyst for me to start living my life the way I want

Who didn t once had the dream of becoming a movie star or a famous musician even if you only got the tree part in your school play or can t even play triangle you have already at least thought about what your life would be like if you were famous I bet you did This movie s about this universal dream played by two individuals who have enough talent and guts to persuade it and they happen to follow in love with each other The rest is art the movie itself is a masterpiece the colors the tunes the choreography it s like watching a movie in Technicolor just amazing It reminded a lot of the Wizard of Oz The final scene I think will be forever stuck in my mind as one of the best endings I have ever seen Why did I give it a 9 Well their connection isn t perfect Don t get me wrong both Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone are great actors but something is missing Lacks chemistry both play their parts masterfully nevertheless they don t get well together they just seem a very unlikely couple I would certainly recommend this movie to anyone who enjoys musicals cinema dreams and everything in between
The only way I can internalize that there are pople out there that gives this film or musical a score over 2 is that they saw a different film and got confused

review_title: A great movie, but not a true musical
review_comment: To me it was sold as a musical but it was actually a movie with music in it It indeed had a lot of performed songs and it had the jazz but that s not what a musical is supposed to be not at all A musical is supposed to tell the story through the music itself and in La La Land the music itself didn t tell the story which is what a musical does it tells the story through the music I acknowledge that it s a great movie but I felt cheated and it disappointed me because I wanted to watch a musical in the likes of Chicago Dreamgirls and Hairspray I wanted to watch a movie that used the music as the means to tell the story

This is a wonderfully happy film to watch The acting story colours dancing soundtrack cannot be criticized in the slightest it is truly wonderful and is now in my top 5 movies of all time I m not a big fan of musicals but it s just so good Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling are amazing and work together beautifully I don t know how much of the singing and dancing they did especially the tap but what they did do was excellent Slightly disappointed at the end but the what could have been last fantasy 5 mins was cleverly done and until the last 30 secs you just weren t sure how it was going to end Made me smile for 90 of the movie Special that s all that needs to be said

With all the hype the movie La La Land was getting during this Award season and the countless nominations it received I wanted to see what all the noise about this movie was about To my surprise it was actually pretty good Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling were phenomenal in it and the songs and music were extraordinary I would recommend this movie to anyone especially if they were into Jazz or musical type of movies It almost sorta of reminded me of growing back in the day and watching High Scholl Musical or even watching Grease Last but certainly not least I didn t know that Emma and Ryan can hold a tone and also can Ryan play the piano did he have to learn for this part and John Legend being in this movie was the icing on the cake for me

can t help but cry while playing it because of the meaning behind the song It was their song The song she heard when she first met him and the song she hears 5 years later when walking into a random Jazz bar one night only to find that it was Sebastian s Not only that but the name of the place was Seb s the name that she suggested We then get a scene of what would have happened if things had all gone right and we see a life where Mia and Sebastian are together and happy but are quickly reminded of reality which teaches a very important lesson We can only move forward 2 people once in love forced to go their separate ways to follow their dreams are once again together sharing a magical moment with the song that started it all 6 years ago I didn t understand but now I do They both found happiness and neither of them would have done it without the other We never know why we are in certain peoples lives but the power we hold to make a difference is immense Now it is my turn to discover what my dream is I am currently trapped in the world of security and stability and the fear of doing something I am not comfortable with This movie has changed my life and I hope to look back in 10 20 30 40 years to credit this film for being the catalyst for me to start living my life the way I want

I didn t like the movie One of the most overrated movies I ve ever seen Although we must pay tribute to marketers and all those who made so much hype around La La Land You may love the picture in several cases you re 14 y o or so for you the form is more important than the content you re a fool who dreams Objectively film has both positive and negative sides that s why my rating is 5 10 not 1 10 but unfortunately many viewers and even critics were guided by emotions rather than common sence while rating La La Land

review_title: Original, fun and surprising. But does it need to be a musical?
review_comment: SCORE 10 10 I have one word to describe my experience watching this movie Serotonin Even when I was completely sobbing in complete depression I still could not help but marvel at the beauty of what I was experiencing When this movie first came out I remember leaving the theater so frustrated at how it ended How could they build up such a beautiful bond between Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone s characters just for them to rip my young heart out by them not ending up together I was furious and never went back to watch it until now You know who I can thank for that Nicole Kidman I am an AMC A List member and every single time her ad plays before a movie I see the short clip from La La Land This movie tackles so many deep topics about life some of which I am in the heat of battle with There is so much pressure to hold a steady job in order to survive in today s world In Sebastian s case he took the steady paying job at the sacrifice of both his dreams and relationship It s amazing what we will tell ourselves to convince ourselves that we are happy Safety is comfort and comfort leads to happiness But we only get one life on this earth Why would we spend it doing something we don t like for the chance that everything else will work out In Mia s case all she wants was for Sebastian to be supportive of her dream as much as she was for him Sure it stung a lot for
